projects.title: Flixr
projects.excerpt: A movie database built in React.js using themoviedb.org API that enables users to explore, search, and bookmark movies.

post.overview1: A movie database built in React.js, utilizing the themoviedb.org API. It incorporates a feature that allows users to add movies to their favorites, with persistent storage ensured through local storage.
post.overview2: In addition, a mockup was created using Photoshop and a prototype was developed using Adobe XD to visualize the design and functionality of the application.

accordions.title: Project Requirements
accordions.content: The project involved building an app connected to the themoviedb.org API. The main requirement was to create a homepage that displays a grid of movies, sortable by popularity, top ratings, current releases, and upcoming releases
accordions.content1: Each movie card on the grid should link to a detailed movie page, showcasing additional information like a summary and a backdrop image. Additionally, a favorites page was implemented to show the user's selected movies.
accordions.content2: The ability to add or remove favorites was implemented on the homepage, movie pages, and the favorites page using local storage.

accordions.title: Development Highlights
accordions.intro: During my work on the Movie Database, I gained valuable experience in team collaboration using GitHub.
accordions.content: I explored various React features that greatly influenced my experience and growth. Let's focus on two standout topics in this summary.

tabs.subtitle: Search Feature
tabs.heading: UseLocation Hook
tabs.content: The useLocation hook returns an object that represents the current URL and provides various properties and methods to access different parts of the URL. In our app, useLocation is used to get the current location object
tabs.content1: By using the location.search property, which represents the query string portion of the URL, the code extracts the value of the 'query' parameter from the URL. This allows the code to retrieve the search query entered by the user, which can be used to fetch relevant movies or display an error message if no movies are found.
tabs.content2: The URLSearchParams is a built-in JavaScript API that provides methods to work with the query string of a URL. It allows you to parse and manipulate the parameters in the URL's query string.
tabs.content3: 'new URLSearchParams'(location.search) creates a new URLSearchParams object using the location.search property, which represents the query string part of the current URL. Then, .get('query') is called on that object to retrieve the value of the 'query' parameter from the URL. This extracts the search query entered by the user.

tabs.subtitle: REST API Fetching
tabs.content: We practiced and implemented both async/await and fetch methods for data fetching.
tabs.heading: Async/Await
tabs.content2: With async/await, we were able to write asynchronous code that looks and feels more like traditional synchronous code, making it easier to handle tasks that require time.
tabs.content1: We also explored the fetch method, which allows us to send requests to retrieve data from external sources. By utilizing then and catch methods, we were able to handle the response and potential errors effectively.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: Throughout this project, I acquired valuable skills in logo creation, mockup design, prototype development, and React.js. Encountering bugs reinforced the importance of thorough testing and debugging for a seamless user experience. This experience highlighted the significance of meticulous bug fixing and code refactoring to enhance the overall code quality.
accordions.content2: We recognized the importance of meticulous testing to ensure a robust and reliable application. Additionally, we identified bugs in the favorite functionality post-deployment, which require refactoring to ensure smooth operation.
accordions.content1: Furthermore, there is an opportunity to enhance the design by incorporating additional movie details such as casting information and YouTube video links for trailers.

accordions.title: Development Highlights
accordions.intro: I want to highlight two key aspects of my development process: the i18n library and the implementation of a Dark/Light theme. These features enhance user experience and accessibility. Let's delve into them:

tabs.subtitle: i18n Library
tabs.heading: internationalization File
tabs.content: I imported the necessary modules for internationalization (i18n) and created this file.
tabs.content1: It loads translation data from JSON files for different sections of the application, merges them into language-specific objects, and initializes the i18n library with the loaded resources.
tabs.content2: The translations can then be accessed using the t object in other files, providing multilingual support for the application.
tabs.content3: The JSON files contain language-specific objects with key-value pairs representing different translations. Each language object (en, fr, es) includes translations for various phrases used in the application.

tabs.subtitle: Dark/Light theme
tabs.heading: UseContext Hook
tabs.content2: Using the useContext hook, I implemented a dark/light theme feature in my application. By adding the class 'light' or 'dark' to the top-level component, I dynamically changed the theme based on user preference. The ThemeToggleButton component allows users to toggle between the themes, and the ThemeContext provides access to the current theme status throughout the application.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: During this project, I deepened my knowledge of React and explored various hooks that I hadn't used before. Implementing the i18n library was a long-awaited achievement for me.
accordions.content1: I discovered that while libraries can save time, it's crucial to invest time in understanding their usage. Sometimes, learning to use a library effectively can be as time-consuming as building the functionality ourselves.
accordions.content2: Several areas could be improved. I rushed into development without properly planning the structure of the JSON file. I should have kept the translations for each language separate instead of combining them into a single file. This approach worked well for most files but made the projects.json file excessively long and difficult to maintain. Refactoring that structure is a priority.
accordions.content3: I need to rectify how I accessed translations in some files. Instead of using the t object, I mistakenly used the i18n object, which unnecessarily complicated things.
accordions.content5: I plan to improve the Accordion file by implementing consistent naming conventions, adding descriptive comments, and organizing the code into smaller, modular functions or components. These changes will enhance code readability, maintainability, and reusability.
accordions.content4: In the future, I plan to add supplementary search functionality that allows users to search projects based on skills. Additionally, integrating Google Analytics is on my roadmap.

post.overview1: A memory matching game implemented in JavaScript, which consists of a grid of cards that the player needs to flip and match in pairs, keeping track of their matches, guesses, and remaining lives.

accordions.title: Project Requirements
accordions.content: The game required creating a single-player experience where the user had to match pairs of hidden pictures on a grid.
accordions.content1: The player can reveal up to two pictures in a turn, and if the pictures match, they remain revealed. If the pictures do not match, they return to being hidden after a certain time.
accordions.content2: The game should keep track of the player's turns, matches, and provide a start button and the option to end the game at any time.

accordions.title: Development Highlights
accordions.intro: I gained experience in utilizing various HTML elements and classes, manipulating the DOM, implementing event listeners, and managing game state variables.

tabs.subtitle: DOM Manipulation
tabs.content: Throughout the game development, I worked extensively with HTML elements, such as divs, buttons, headings, and images, to structure and present the user interface.

tabs.subtitle: Game State Management
tabs.content: To enable user interaction, I implemented event listeners that responded to actions like clicks or key presses. By attaching these event listeners to specific HTML elements, I could trigger appropriate actions and functions based on user input.
tabs.content1: Additionally, I managed the game's state variables, including lockCards, flippedCards, matches, guesses, and livesLeft. These variables played a crucial role in tracking the game's progress, implementing rules and mechanics, controlling the flow of the game, and updating the display accordingly.
tabs.content2: This comprehensive approach to event handling and game state management resulted in an engaging and interactive game experience for the players.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: In addition to managing game state variables and manipulating the DOM, I also acquired fundamental CSS skills, including flexbox and CSS grid. Furthermore, I gained knowledge and proficiency in implementing sound effects within the game.
accordions.content2: I want to improve my code by changing the way I approach it. Currently, I rely mostly on functions, but I plan to switch to using objects more extensively. By using objects as the main components of my code, I can make it better organized, structured, and easier to reuse in different parts of the game. This change will bring several benefits and help me create a more efficient and maintainable codebase.
accordions.content1: I would love to enhance the User Interface (UI) and create a more captivating experience.

projects.title: French Baking App - Case Study
projects.excerpt: Conducted a comprehensive case study during the Google UX Certificate program, focusing on designing a fictional French baking app using Figma.

post.overview1: This case study delves into the development of a fictional French Baking App, completed as part of the UX Google Certificate program. While the quality of this work may not meet my highest standards, I aim to showcase it as a testament to the knowledge and skills gained throughout the process. The study encompasses various phases, including UX Analysis, UX Design and Prototyping, and concludes with a retrospective evaluation

tabs.subtitle: Problem Understanding and Research
tabs.heading: Problem Definition/Goal
tabs.content: The problem definition/goal for this project is to create an app that addresses the challenge of long lineups for busy customers at French Baking, enabling them to pre-order for pick-up or delivery, saving time and providing convenience.
tabs.content1: User research was conducted to gain insights into the preferences and needs of the target customers at French Baking. This research aimed to understand their ordering behaviors and identify pain points, informing the development of the app.

tabs.subtitle: User Analysis and Insights
tabs.content: One primary user group identified during the research process was busy adults who desired a convenient way to order from French Baking without waiting in long lineups.
tabs.heading: Pain Points Identification
tabs.content2: Key pain points identified during user research include time constraints for working adults and busy students, disappointment caused by out of stock items, and the absence of an app for pre-ordering at the bakery.
tabs.content3: A detailed persona named Nate was created during the development phase to represent the target user, providing valuable insights into their characteristics, needs, and goals. Nate's persona guided design decisions and feature prioritization for the French Baking app.
tabs.content4: User journey mapping identified touchpoints, emotions, and pain points in the app's user experience, revealing insights for user-centered design and development.

accordions.title: UX Design and Prototyping
accordions.intro: During the UX Design and Prototyping phase, several key activities were conducted to shape the app's design and create prototypes for testing and evaluation.

tabs.subtitle: Wireframing
tabs.heading: Paper Wireframe
tabs.content: Initial sketches and basic layouts were created on paper to establish the visual structure and organization of the app.
tabs.content1: The paper wireframes were translated into digital form, allowing for more detailed visualization and interaction design.
tabs.content2: A low-fidelity prototype was developed, providing a basic representation of the app's functionality and user interface. This prototype allowed for early user testing and feedback to refine the design.

tabs.subtitle: Usability Findings
tabs.content: Usability testing was conducted to gather feedback and insights from users interacting with the low-fidelity prototype. The findings helped identify usability issues, refine the design, and enhance the overall user experience
tabs.content1: Usability findings indicated that users preferred a less cluttered homepage, wanted information about pick-up and delivery presented once, and favored a separate section for personalized options.

tabs.subtitle: Mockup
tabs.heading: Mockup
tabs.content: A visual representation of the app's interface design was created to showcase the overall look and feel.
tabs.content1: A fully interactive and visually polished prototype was developed, simulating the app's functionality and providing a realistic user experience
tabs.content2: NOTE: The prototype provided is not fully functional, as certain features like navigation have not been implemented. However, I have plans to continue working on it to improve its functionality.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: During this case study, I gained valuable insights and knowledge about various aspects of user experience design, including problem definition, user research, pain point identification, persona development, user journey mapping, wireframing, usability testing, and prototyping. I also learned the importance of allowing sufficient time for each phase of the design process to ensure higher quality outcomes.
accordions.content2: I rushed through this case study to complete the Google UX Certificate and avoid paying monthly fees for an extended period. I pursued this certificate as a personal learning experience. Regrettably, the rushed process resulted in a mediocre user interface and various issues with the PDF.
accordions.content3: Despite its shortcomings, I still want to share it because it provided valuable insights. The rushed timeline compromised the quality, but with my increased knowledge and experience, I recognize the potential for significant improvement with more time and effort.

projects.title: Best Buy Usability Report
projects.excerpt: In a collaborative effort with a team of five, we conducted a comprehensive usability report for Best Buy, assessing its user experience and documenting key findings.

post.overview1: The Best Buy Usability Report aims to evaluate the user experience and provide actionable recommendations for improvement. The report consists of several sections, each focusing on a specific aspect of the evaluation process.

accordions.title: Methodology
accordions.content: Six participants were recruited for the usability evaluation, and the data collection process was conducted remotely using Zoom calls. The recruitment process aimed to identify participants who represented the ideal user type for Best Buy's target audience. By selecting diverse participants, we ensured a comprehensive evaluation of the user experience.

tabs.subtitle: Persona
tabs.content: To further understand the target users, a persona was created based on the collected data and insights gained from the participants. The persona represents the characteristics, goals, and needs of the typical Best Buy user. This persona serves as a reference point throughout the evaluation process, guiding the assessment and helping to identify areas of improvement.

tabs.subtitle: Moderator Script
tabs.content: n order to ensure consistency and standardized testing procedures, a moderator script was developed for the usability evaluation. The moderator script served as a guide for the moderators conducting the tests, outlining the instructions, tasks, and questions to be asked during the evaluation sessions.

accordions.title: Usability Test
accordions.intro: At the beginning of the test, we introduced the project to each participant, providing them with an overview of the objectives and expectations. Following the introduction, participants were asked to fill out a pre-test questionnaire. This questionnaire aimed to gather initial information about their background, preferences, and prior experience related to the project.

tabs.subtitle: Usability Tasks
tabs.content: The usability tasks were designed to evaluate specific aspects of the project's functionality and user interaction. Two of the tasks included in the test were:
tabs.heading: First Click / Five Second / Preference Test
tabs.content1: Participants engaged in three tests: the First Click Test, where they clicked on their initial action to evaluate interface intuitiveness; the Five Second Test, gathering feedback on impressions and design effectiveness; and the Preference Test, revealing user preferences and guiding design decisions.

tabs.subtitle: Think Aloud Tasks
tabs.content: In addition to the usability tasks, participants were given four tasks to complete while vocalizing their thoughts and actions. This approach, known as the 'think aloud' method, enabled us to gain insights into their decision-making processes, user flow, and any difficulties or areas of confusion they encountered.
tabs.content1: For example, one of the tasks involved using the search function to find a specific product. We closely observed the participants' process and analyzed their thinking patterns as they navigated the site, seeking to understand their search strategies, challenges faced, and overall satisfaction with the search functionality
tabs.content2: Throughout the usability test, we took careful notes, recorded observations, and collected feedback from the participants to further analyze and evaluate the user experience.

accordions.title: Reporting Results
accordions.content: We analyzed the test results and utilized graphs for better visualization. Additionally, we implemented the System Usability Scale (SUS) to evaluate overall usability.
accordions.content1: The successful usability test sessions uncovered areas for improvement, including addressing overwhelming options, enhancing clarity between 'in stock' and 'out of stock' items, implementing an accessible FAQ page, integrating voice activation and AI search functionality, and considering interface enhancements to strike a balance between simplicity and advanced features.

projects.title: Craigslist Design Brief
projects.excerpt: Developed a design brief for Craigslist, outlining user-centered design solutions to enhance the platform's usability and visual appeal.

post.overview1: The design brief encompassed analyzing baseline statistics, conducting competitive analysis, defining user tasks and archetypes, creating scenarios and personas, mapping user journeys, developing mind maps and site maps, identifying facets and user flows, optimizing SEO metadata, and creating wireframes for the Craigslist redesign.

tabs.subtitle: Research and Analysis
tabs.heading: Purpose and Mission Goals
tabs.content: Craigslist aims to be a user-friendly, secure, and inclusive platform for local transactions, connecting people and fostering trust. Its goals include improving functionality, expanding globally, forming partnerships, and implementing green initiatives.
tabs.content2: The competitive analysis, conducted with the help of Website Grader and Nibbler, evaluated platforms like Facebook Marketplace, OfferUp, and Kijiji, focusing on their design, navigation, profile visibility, messaging system, search functionality, and user base.

tabs.subtitle: User Insights and Definition
tabs.content: Craigslist users perform tasks like browsing categories, contacting sellers, negotiating prices, and meeting in person. They can be classified into archetypes such as deal-seekers, crafters, job seekers, home-seekers, freelancers, entrepreneurs, pet owners, performers, and students. Challenges include identifying reliable sellers, secure communication, meeting arrangements, secure payments, and addressing post-purchase issues.

accordions.title: Information Organization
accordions.intro: At the core of effective information organization on Craigslist are visualization techniques such as mind maps and site maps that help structure and navigate the website.

tabs.subtitle: Visualization
tabs.content: Mind maps offer a visual representation of the website's information architecture, showcasing the relationships between different categories and subcategories.
tabs.heading: Mind Map
tabs.content1: Site maps provide a hierarchical overview of the website's pages and content, allowing users to easily understand its structure and navigate to their desired sections.
tabs.content2: By utilizing these visualization tools, Craigslist enhances user understanding and exploration of its extensive listings and services.

tabs.subtitle: User Journey
tabs.content: The user journey on Craigslist involves various steps, from conducting research and contacting sellers to meeting in person and completing the transaction.
tabs.content1: Throughout this journey, users may encounter challenges such as identifying honest sellers, negotiating prices, ensuring safety during meetings, and addressing post-purchase issues.
tabs.content2: To enhance the user experience, Craigslist can implement features like user ratings, secure communication channels, scheduling options, secure payment systems, and resources for identifying common issues with used items.

accordions.title: Design & Optimization
accordions.content: When it comes to design and optimization on Craigslist, a focus is placed on creating a user-friendly and intuitive interface that allows for smooth interactions and seamless navigation.
accordions.content1: The user flow is carefully designed to guide users through the process of browsing listings, contacting sellers, and making transactions, ensuring a streamlined experience.

tabs.subtitle: Interaction
tabs.heading: User Flow
tabs.content1: The user flow on Craigslist for tasks like buying a car involves steps such as researching, contacting sellers, meeting in person, and completing the purchase, providing a clear path for users to follow.
tabs.content3: Wireframes are used in the design process to create low-fidelity visual representations of the website's layout and functionality, allowing for early testing and refinement of the user interface.

tabs.subtitle: Optimization
tabs.heading: Facets
tabs.content1: Faceted search is implemented on Craigslist, enabling users to narrow down search results by applying filters based on categories, conditions, price ranges, dates posted, and locations.
tabs.content: To improve the searchability of the website, SEO metadata is utilized, including title tags and description tags, providing concise and relevant information that helps search engines understand the content of each page.

projects.title: Reactulator
projects.excerpt: A calculator made with React.

post.overview1: This app is a React-based calculator that allows users to perform arithmetic calculations and store values in memory.

accordions.title: Project Requirements
accordions.content: Create a calculator with basic arithmetic operations, memory functionality, support for decimal numbers, and the ability to change the sign of a number.

accordions.title: Development Highlights
accordions.intro: During the development of this project, I focused on implementing a modular component structure and familiarizing myself with React hooks.

tabs.subtitle: Modular Structure
tabs.content: The code is organized into separate components (e.g., Header, Keypad, Display) to promote reusability and maintainability. This modular approach improves code organization and makes it easier to understand and manage.

tabs.subtitle: React Hooks
tabs.content: I utilized the useState hook to manage and update state variables in functional components. This allowed me to track and modify values like currentValue, previousValue, and memoryValue in an intuitive and efficient manner.

accordions.title: Retrospective
accordions.question: What did I learn?
accordions.content: During the development of the calculator app, I gained hands-on experience in working with React components, managing state using hooks, and implementing calculator functionalities such as handling operator clicks, performing calculations, and managing memory. This project helped me deepen my understanding of React and enhance my skills in building interactive user interfaces.
accordions.content2: Reflecting back, there are several areas in the calculator app that could benefit from improvement.
accordions.content3: Firstly, the code could be simplified and made less redundant through refactoring. Breaking down the logic into smaller functions and components would enhance manageability and ease of maintenance.
accordions.content4: Moreover, adding more comments and documentation to clarify the code's purpose and functionality would enhance its understandability for others and future reference.
accordions.content5: Lastly, exploring and implementing unit tests would ensure the reliability and robustness of the calculator app's functionalities.

tabs.content2: URLSearchParams es una API incorporada de JavaScript que proporciona mtodos para trabajar con la cadena de consulta de una URL. Permite analizar y manipular los parmetros en la cadena de consulta de la URL.
tabs.content3: En el cdigo anterior, new URLSearchParams(location.search) crea un nuevo objeto URLSearchParams utilizando la propiedad location.search, que representa la parte de la cadena de consulta de la URL actual. Luego, se llama a .get('query') en ese objeto para recuperar el valor del parmetro 'query' de la URL. Esto extrae la consulta de bsqueda ingresada por el usuario.

projects.excerpt: Un juego que pone a prueba preguntas sobre desarrollo front-end para desafiar a GPT. Este juego fue desarrollado durante el evento Hack the Break 2023 con mi compaero de clase Connor del programa FWD en BCIT.

post.overview1: Este proyecto es un juego que desafa a los jugadores a poner a prueba sus conocimientos de HTML, CSS y JavaScript mientras se enfrentan a un enemigo, utilizando conceptos de programacin orientada a objetos.

accordions.Exigencias del proyecto: El proyecto tena un plazo de dos das, comenzando el sbado y terminando el domingo, y requera la entrega de un video de presentacin de 3 minutos en YouTube, accesible pblicamente, al da siguiente. El video de presentacin deba incluir una descripcin del proyecto, el problema que busca resolver y una demostracin del proyecto. El tema del proyecto es la seguridad laboral, y tenamos la libertad de explorar nuestras propias ideas y enfoques.

accordions.title: Puntos clave del desarrollo
accordions.intro: Durante el hackathon, nuestro equipo tena conocimientos limitados de programacin, pero hicimos nuestro mejor esfuerzo. Nos enfrentamos a desafos al aprender GitHub, lo que provoc algunos retrasos. Adems, no estbamos familiarizados con estructuras basadas en componentes como SASS o componentes de React, lo cual habra facilitado el trabajo en equipo.

tabs.subtitle: GitHub
tabs.content: Enfrentamos algunos desafos al manejar conflictos en la interfaz de GitHub y encontramos problemas. Debido a la limitacin de tiempo asociada al plazo, tomamos la decisin de abandonar una rama y crear una nueva, ya que no estbamos seguros de un enfoque mejor.

accordions.title: Retrospectiva
accordions.question: Qu aprend?
accordions.content: Mi primer hackathon en lnea me ense la importancia de participar y enfrentar desafos, incluso con conocimientos limitados. Si tuviramos que hacer el mismo hackathon nuevamente, apuntaramos a un proyecto ms avanzado. Tambin descubr que el trabajo en equipo efectivo requiere colaboracin en diferentes archivos, lo cual fue un desafo en este proyecto.
accordions.content2: El juego debe completarse y la interfaz de usuario (UI) debe ser pulida. Abandonamos el juego justo al final del hackathon y volvimos a nuestros apretados horarios en BCIT.
accordions.content3: Nuestro prximo paso debera ser reconstruir el sitio utilizando lenguajes de programacin modulares como React u otro framework, as como SCSS o Tailwind CSS. Esto nos permitira trabajar de manera ms eficiente y rpida.
accordions.content4: Originalmente, queramos utilizar la API Chat GPT para obtener las preguntas de manera dinmica en lugar de codificarlas directamente en nuestro archivo JS. No sabamos cmo hacerlo durante el hackathon, pero ahora tenemos el conocimiento para refactorizarlo.
